comment: I took Professor Knapton's online class for US History I. Professor Knapton made it nearly impossible for any student to fail the class. If you took the quizzes on time, you always benefitted from a curve (even if a student happened to make a 100 on a quiz). I'm not a big history person, but Professor Knapton made me eager to learn history!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I'll be honest, I did not really listen at all in this class and managed to make a B. Her extra credit is no joke. She makes it to where it is almost impossible to fail. She's super energetic and passionate about history. Her only flaw is not being able to grade things quickly. Other than that, awesome professor.

Professor Knapton was very energetic and interesting. History is not my favorite subject, but she managed to keep my attention with her lectures. She gave extra credit assignments for every test and her tests were straight from lecture. Pretty easy and very entertaining class.

She is very passionate about history and her lectures are more like performances, she is very entertaining. I highly recommend taking her. I got a D on the first test, but she offers so much extra credit I ended up making an A in the class.

Liberal with extra-credit assignments. Tests were simple and written examples were from a mixture of lecture and PowerPoint. Was exceptionally late on grading assignments, but I don't see how this is that big a deal. If you didn't make an A with her, you weren't trying.  She was very eager about the subject and tried to make students the same.

She is a very energetic professor. I like her class and the things she talks about makes you think. Going to class is a good idea and taking notes is a must. This semester grading was a little slow but it really wasn't her fault. The assignments weren't really easy. Her study guides really helped.

Unprofessional and disorganized. Avoid her at all costs. Rude and condescending if you ask questions. You'll never know where you stand. I think they're saving a page in the history books for when she actually grades an assignment.

Very passionate, loves history & makes you love it too. You know what to know for exams if you show up to class and take notes. Has really helpful study guides, so never lost.  So much extra credit how can anyone fail?!  Grades were slow because essays given during all the snow days which she explained. Waiting is not fun but not strike against her

One of the best professors I have ever had. Yes, it is not the easiest class in the world, but she gives a ton of extra credit and she is very helpful and passionate about history! You will not regret taking her.

She's an EXCELLENT instructor. Her passion and energy for history is contagious and she is very animated when demonstrating different perspectives. Her grading can lag a bit, but she offers more than a complete letter grade's worth of extra credit so her class is worth it in my opinion. Study the power points and videos and you'll be fine!

I see that she has a bad rating, and I have no idea why! She has been my favorite teacher in my whole life. You have to attend class and work hard to get good grades, but she is so passionate about history, that she makes you love it too! She's friendly and hilarious as well. I definitely recommend her for World History.

By far one of the easiest teachers I've ever taken. Her lectures are somewhat scattered, but her tests are straight off the powerpoints. Very sweet lady, and she usually is reachable during her office hours. Pay attention in class, study the notes/powerpoints, and there is no reason why you shouldn't receive an A.

Do NOT take her. She is the worst professor I have ever had. She randomly went through materials as she likes which you can never find any related information from anywhere. She only posts some useless powerpoint with ONLY pictures online which makes you can't study at home by yourself!!!

Do not take her. Randomly goes throughout history spitting out random theories with no information to back them up. Texting is preferred but she does not text back. Complains about grading yet she is the one who assigns essays to 200+ person classes. Did not get grades in before Withdraw Period.

Can't follow her at all, she talks at 1000MPH but is all over the place with no apparent logic behind her thought process. She asks you to text her for questions and when you do she never responds, nor does she do so for emails. She asks for written assignments for a 200+ person class then complains about all the grading she has to do. Do not take!
